gov.usgs.anss.waveserver

Class WaveServerClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.waveserver.WaveServerClient

  • public class WaveServerClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a client to WaveServer for most of the common commands. It maintains a structure will MenuItem objects for each channel in the MENU and can retrieve the information from the last MENU by calling getMenuChannel(). 
     Supported WaveServer commands :
 getMENU()     populates the menu structure with MenuItems for each channel
 getMENUSCNL() ask server for menu from one channel.
 getSCNLRAW()  trace bufs in an ArrayList
 getSCNLRAWAsTimeSeriesBlocks()  trace bufs in an ArrayList of TimeSeriesBlocks
 getSCNL()     Get data returned as ASCII, but converted to ints by this routine.
 Winston Command additions:
 getSCNLHELIRAW() Returned mins an maxes filtered and sampled at 1 Hz suitable for Swarm Helicorders
 getWAVERAW()   Get data in raw wave format (basically a single array of data)
 getCHANNELS()  Get channel related metadata
 getMETADATAINSTRUMENT Get the instrument metadata - requires server have connection to a MetaDataServer
 getMETADATACHANNEL() Get the channel metadata ala Winston
 getSTATUS()    Return a status stream from the server
 getVERSION()   REturn the version string.
    For all trace commands (getSCNL(), getSCNLRAW, getWAVERAW(), the returned rate, start time, gap string (like 'FG', 'FL','FR' or 'F') are available by methods after each call and before the next call via getGapString(). 
     Testing a single command can be done with :
 java -cp $PATH/QueryMom.jar gov.usgs.anss.waveserver.WaveServerClient ARGS
 -c MENU|MENUSCNL|GETSCNL|GETSCNLRAW|GETSCNLHELIRAW|GETWAVERAW|GMDC|GMDI|STATUS|GETCHANNELS -s NSCL -b date -e date -f fill -h HOST -p port(2060) -pin PIN -r requestid -ms
    GETSCNL requires -s -b -e
    MENUSCNL requires -s
    GETSCNLRAW requires -s -b -e
    GETSCNLRAW with -ms will create MiniSeed files from the resulting TraceBufs
    GMDC is GETMETADATAA: CHANNEL and GMDI is GETMETADATA: INSTRUMENT
    NSCL must be in exact NNSSSSSCCCLL form (spaces count!).  Spaces or hyphens can be used
    -h  IP.OF.Server  Set the host (def=localhost)
    -p  port          Sets the port (def=2060
    -b or -e Date     beginning and ending data in yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss.mmm format (slashes or dashes in date supported - dash to separate time from date allowed)
    -test omit the -c but include -s -b and -e will run ALL of the commands and compare the waveforms returned by GETSCNL,GETSCNLRAW, and GETWAVERAW
    -ms LL with GETSCNLRAW will convert the returned trace bufs to MiniSEED with location code LL - useful for debugging
    -fill FILL changes the fill value from 2147000000
    -r RID changes the request ID from GS to RID
   -pin PID sets the PIN replacing the default 0000
    There is the argument -test which for the given host and port will run all of the command and do some testing of the results - the result of GETSCNL, GETSCNLRAW, and

        public double getStart()
        For the last command (GETSCNL, GETWAVERAW and GETSCNLRAW only) this is the returned start time - some commands do not return a start time
        Returns:
        The time since 1970 as decimal seconds (per normal wave servers, NOT the time for Winston WaveServers)

      • freeMemory

        public void freeMemory(java.util.ArrayList<TraceBuf> tbs)
        Free memory of trace bufs returned by GETSNCLRAW(). This should be called after the tracebufs from a GETSCNLRAW() are no longer needed. These trace bufs are maintained in a pool for reuse rather than letting them be reaped constantly by the garbage collector. Failure to call this will eventually create so many TraceBufs in the pool that heap space will run out!
        Parameters:
        tbs - The ArrayList of TimeSeriesBlocks with the returned data to free

      • freeMemoryTSB

        public void freeMemoryTSB(java.util.ArrayList<TimeSeriesBlock> tbs)
        Free memory of trace bufs returned by GETSNCLRAW(). This should be called after the tracebufs from a GETSCNLRAW() are no longer needed. These trace bufs are maintained in a pool for reuse rather than letting them be reaped constantly by the garbage collector. Failure to call this will eventually create so many TraceBufs in the pool that heap space will run out!
        Parameters:
        tbs - The ArrayList of TimeSeriesBlocks with the returned data to free

      • getSCNLHELIRAW

        public int getSCNLHELIRAW(java.lang.String reqid,
                          java.lang.String seedname,
                          java.util.GregorianCalendar start,
                          java.util.GregorianCalendar end,
                          boolean compress,
                          long[] time,
                          double[] min,
                          double[] max)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This gets data suitable for a helicorder (times, minimum, maximum) at one sample per second. The arrays must be big enough to hold the requested duration at 1 sps, or a Array bounds exception will happen
        Parameters:
        reqid -
        seedname - A NNSSSSSCCCLL
        start - Start time
        end - End Time
        compress - if true, the connections should use the compression
        time - Returned with times of each sample
        min - Returned with minimum value of each sample
        max - Returned with maximum value of each sample
        Returns:
        The number of data points returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getWAVERAW

        public int getWAVERAW(java.lang.String reqid,
                      java.lang.String seedname,
                      java.util.GregorianCalendar start,
                      java.util.GregorianCalendar end,
                      boolean compress,
                      int[] data)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This gets data suitable for a helicorder (times, minimum, maximum) at one sample per second. The arrays must be big enough to hold the requested duration at 1 sps, or a Array bounds exception will happen. Note: Right after getting the data the user might want to get the header values for the : 
         start time (getRawWaveMillis(),
 data rate (getRawWaveRate()),
 registrationOffset (getRawWaveRegistrationOffset())
        Parameters:
        reqid - Some request ID
        seedname - A NNSSSSSCCCLL
        start - Start time
        end - End Time
        compress - if true, the connections should use the compression
        data - The array of ints to get the data points
        Returns:
        The number of data points returned.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getRawWaveRegistrationOffset

        public double getRawWaveRegistrationOffset()
        This is the registration offset returned by the last call to getRAWWAVE
        Returns:
        The registration offset (what ever that is!)

      • getSCNL

        public int getSCNL(java.lang.String reqid,
                   java.lang.String scnl,
                   java.util.GregorianCalendar start,
                   java.util.GregorianCalendar end,
                   java.lang.String fill,
                   int[] data)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Request data in the ASCII format - generally used by GUIs
        Parameters:
        reqid - The request ID
        scnl - A NNSSSSSCCCLL in normal form. It can contain "hyphens"
        start - Start time
        end - End time
        fill - Fill value for missing data
        data - Returned with the data (this must be big enough when this routine is called)
        Returns:
        the number of data points in data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getMENUSCNL

        public MenuItem getMENUSCNL(java.lang.String reqid,
                            java.lang.String seedname)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        This returns a MenuItem for the given seed name, by going to the server and asking for this one channel Note: This is different than using getMENUChannel() which returns the same information, but at the time of the last getMENU()
        Parameters:
        reqid - The request ID
        seedname - The seedname
        Returns:
        Null if no seedname is found, else a menu item for that seedname
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getMENU

        public void getMENU(java.lang.String reqid)
             throws java.io.IOException
        The infamous getMENU from a wave server - populate the tree map with menu items representing this menu. Update or create new MenuItems as needed. Once the menu is gotten normally individual rows would be obtained with getMenuChannel()
        Parameters:
        reqid - The request ID
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getMenuChannel

        public MenuItem getMenuChannel(java.lang.String network,
                               java.lang.String station,
                               java.lang.String channel,
                               java.lang.String location)
        Return the Menu Item (or null) for the menu for the given net, station, chan, location
        Parameters:
        network - up to 2 character network code (empty network codes are not allowed)
        station - up to 5 character station code
        channel - up to 3 character (normally exactly 3 character) channel code
        location - up to 2 character location code
        Returns:

      • getMenuChannel

        public MenuItem getMenuChannel(java.lang.String seedname)
        Get the MenuItem (or null) for the given seedname
        Parameters:
        seedname - A NNSSSSSCCCLL seedname - spaces to pad the fixed fields - no delimiters
        Returns:

      • getSCNLRAWAsTimeSeriesBlocks

        public void getSCNLRAWAsTimeSeriesBlocks(java.lang.String reqid,
                                         java.lang.String scnl,
                                         java.util.GregorianCalendar start,
                                         java.util.GregorianCalendar end,
                                         boolean tbPool,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<TimeSeriesBlock> tbtt)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Request raw data as TimeSerisBlock packets. The ArrayList will only contain the subclass TraceBufs, but this will return the super class for convenience. Please remember to call freeMemory() with the return with the return if tbPool use is specified true to free the pool space!
        Parameters:
        reqid - The request ID
        scnl - A NNSSSSSCCCLL in normal form. It can contain "hyphens"
        start - Start time
        end - End time
        tbPool - If true, TraceBufs will come from a TraceBufPool. The user must call freeMemory with returned values
        tbtt - The ArrayList of TraceBufs as their superclass TimeSeriesBlocks that will have all responsive data added to this structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getSCNRAWAsTimeSeriesBlocks

        public void getSCNRAWAsTimeSeriesBlocks(java.lang.String reqid,
                                        java.lang.String scnl,
                                        java.util.GregorianCalendar start,
                                        java.util.GregorianCalendar end,
                                        boolean tbPool,
                                        java.util.ArrayList<TimeSeriesBlock> tbtt)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Request raw data as TimeSerisBlock packets. The ArrayList will only contain the subclass TraceBufs, but this will return the super class for convenience. Please remember to call freeMemory() with the return with the return if tbPool use is specified true to free the pool space!
        Parameters:
        reqid - The request ID
        scnl - A NNSSSSSCCCLL in normal form. It can contain "hyphens"
        start - Start time
        end - End time
        tbPool - If true, TraceBufs will come from a TraceBufPool. The user must call freeMemory with returned values
        tbtt - The ArrayList of TraceBufs as their superclass TimeSeriesBlocks that will have all responsive data added to this structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getSCNRAW

        public void getSCNRAW(java.lang.String reqid,
                      java.lang.String scnl,
                      java.util.GregorianCalendar start,
                      java.util.GregorianCalendar end,
                      boolean tbPool,
                      java.util.ArrayList<TraceBuf> tbs)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Request raw data as TraceBuf packets. Please remember to call freeMemory() with the return if tbPool use is specified true to clear the pool space
        Parameters:
        reqid - The request ID
        scnl - A NNSSSSSCCCLL in normal form. It can contain "hyphens", the location code is ignored.
        start - Start time
        end - End time
        tbPool - If true, TraceBufs will come from a TraceBufPool. The user must call freeMemory with returned values
        tbs - The ArrayList of TraceBufs that will have all responsive data added to this structure
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
